I do have a hell of a time trying to imagine a enterprise architecture 
that connects to the outside using only HTTP. Actually, in the 
infrastructure we tried to Restify we only use HTTP internally. So when 
we decided to expose our services thru REST resources we knew that the 
same resource will have to be accessed in multiple ways, not only HTTP, 
and didn't make any sense to expose the same services in several ways, 
being the REstfull only for HTTP.

I mean, what company doesn't use now email, or JMS for instance, in 
their day to day operations? We do it, using diferent connectors to 
connect to our resources, in protocols like JMS and IMAP and intra-VM 
and I think some more.

If this isn't a very usual case in the companies everywhere I would be 
much surprised...

> want to have one hell of a good reason to deviate from it (e.g. 
> performance, latency) as using it as the "universal interface"
